id: J Allen Brack interview | Blizzard's new President on the future of the video games giant
paragraph:
On the lavish Mythic stage at BlizzCon, a baton was passed.Mike Morhaime, co-founder of Blizzard Entertainment, bid an emotional farewell to the Warcraft developer’s rowdy fans. Morhaime has stepped down as Blizzard’s president after 27 years spent overseeing the Irvine, California developer’s rise to one of the most successful video game companies on the planet. Whamit started as a three man project has turned into a behemoth that employs over 5000 people.Taking the reigns as president is J Allen Brack, a Blizzard stalwart of 12 years and former executive producer of the phenomenally successful World of Warcraft.
